propertiesClass.name: countDownWithAlert$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
this.data.countDown.pipe(
    tap((seconds) =>
      seconds % 10 === 0
        ? this.liveAnnouncer.announce(`Session expires in ${seconds} seconds`)
        : ''
    ),
    finalize(() => this.liveAnnouncer.clear())
  )

Sorry, we can't proceed with your online application

As you didn’t understand some or all of the terms in the knowledge check, we sadly can’t take your application forward right now. You can still apply for a With Profits ISA via a Wesleyan Financial Services Consultant (initial advice fee of 3% will apply), or you can re-apply online when you’re more familiar with the terms.

What would you like to do now?

Learn more Return to the With Profits ISA page to learn more before re-applying.
Book an appointment Make an appointment with a Wesleyan Financial Services Consultant to discuss your options.

components.name: ManualAddressFormComponent

propertiesClass.name: form

components.templateData:
<form [formGroup]="form">
  <wes-form-field id="flatNumberFormField">
    <wes-label labelTestId="lblFlatNumber">{{
      pageContent.addressDetails.flatNumber.inputLabel
    }}</wes-label>
    <input
      wesInput
      type="text"
      formControlName="flatNumber"
      data-test="txtFlatNumber"
    />
  </wes-form-field>

  <wes-form-field id="houseNumberFormField">
    <wes-label labelTestId="lblHouseNumber">{{
      pageContent.addressDetails.houseNumber.inputLabel
    }}</wes-label>
    <input
      wesInput
      type="text"
      formControlName="houseNumber"
      autocomplete="address-line1"
      data-test="txtHouseNumber"
    />
    <wes-error *ngIf="isFieldInvalid('houseNumber')">
      <wes-form-field-error *ngIf="controls.houseNumber.errors.required">
        {{ pageContent.addressDetails.houseNumber.inputError }}
      </wes-form-field-error>
    </wes-error>
  </wes-form-field>

  <wes-form-field id="houseNameFormField">
    <wes-label labelTestId="lblHouseName">{{
      pageContent.addressDetails.houseName.inputLabel
    }}</wes-label>
    <input
      wesInput
      type="text"
      formControlName="houseName"
      data-test="txtHouseName"
    />
    <wes-error *ngIf="isFieldInvalid('houseName')">
      <wes-form-field-error *ngIf="controls.houseName.errors.required">
        {{ pageContent.addressDetails.houseName.inputError }}
      </wes-form-field-error>
    </wes-error>
  </wes-form-field>

  <wes-form-field id="streetFormField">
    <wes-label labelTestId="lblStreet">{{
      pageContent.addressDetails.street.inputLabel
    }}</wes-label>
    <input
      wesInput
      type="text"
      formControlName="street"
      [errorStateMatcher]="errorStateMatcher"
      autocomplete="address-line2"
      data-test="txtStreet"
    />
    <wes-error *ngIf="isFieldInvalid('street')">
      <wes-form-field-error *ngIf="controls.street.errors.required">
        {{ pageContent.addressDetails.street.inputError }}
      </wes-form-field-error>
    </wes-error>
  </wes-form-field>

  <wes-form-field id="townFormField">
    <wes-label labelTestId="lblTown">{{
      pageContent.addressDetails.town.inputLabel
    }}</wes-label>
    <input
      wesInput
      type="text"
      formControlName="town"
      [errorStateMatcher]="errorStateMatcher"
      autocomplete="address-level2"
      data-test="txtTown"
    />
    <wes-error *ngIf="isFieldInvalid('town')">
      <wes-form-field-error *ngIf="controls.town.errors.required">
        {{ pageContent.addressDetails.town.inputError }}
      </wes-form-field-error>
    </wes-error>
  </wes-form-field>

  <wes-form-field id="regionFormField">
    <wes-label labelTestId="lblRegion">{{
      pageContent.addressDetails.region.inputLabel
    }}</wes-label>
    <input
      wesInput
      type="text"
      formControlName="region"
      data-test="txtRegion"
    />
  </wes-form-field>

  <wes-form-field id="countyFormField">
    <wes-label labelTestId="lblCounty">{{
      pageContent.addressDetails.county.inputLabel
    }}</wes-label>
    <input
      wesInput
      type="text"
      formControlName="county"
      data-test="txtCounty"
    />
  </wes-form-field>

  <wes-form-field id="manualPostcodeFormField">
    <wes-label labelTestId="lblPostcode">{{
      pageContent.addressDetails.postcode.inputLabel
    }}</wes-label>
    <input
      wesInput
      type="text"
      formControlName="postcode"
      [errorStateMatcher]="errorStateMatcher"
      autocomplete="postal-code"
      data-test="txtPostcode"
    />
    <wes-error *ngIf="isFieldInvalid('postcode')">
      <wes-form-field-error *ngIf="controls.postcode.errors.required">
        {{ pageContent.addressDetails.postcode.inputError }}
      </wes-form-field-error>
    </wes-error>
  </wes-form-field>
</form>
<!-- Valid {{ form.valid }} -->

components.name: MatSelect

inputsClass.name: aria-label
inputsClass.description: Aria label of the select. If not specified, the placeholder will be used as label.

inputsClass.name: aria-labelledby
inputsClass.description: Input that can be used to specify the aria-labelledby attribute.

inputsClass.name: compareWith
inputsClass.description: Function to compare the option values with the selected values. The first argument is a value from an option. The second is a value from the selection. A boolean should be returned.

inputsClass.name: disableOptionCentering
inputsClass.description: Whether to center the active option over the trigger.

inputsClass.name: errorStateMatcher
inputsClass.description: Object used to control when error messages are shown.

inputsClass.name: id
inputsClass.description: Unique id of the element.

inputsClass.name: multiple
inputsClass.description: Whether the user should be allowed to select multiple options.

inputsClass.name: panelClass
inputsClass.description: Classes to be passed to the select panel. Supports the same syntax as ngClass.

inputsClass.name: placeholder
inputsClass.description: Placeholder to be shown if no value has been selected.

inputsClass.name: required
inputsClass.description: Whether the component is required.

inputsClass.name: sortComparator
inputsClass.description: Function used to sort the values in a select in multiple mode. Follows the same logic as Array.prototype.sort.

inputsClass.name: typeaheadDebounceInterval
inputsClass.description: Time to wait in milliseconds after the last keystroke before moving focus to an item.

inputsClass.name: value
inputsClass.description: Value of the select control.

outputsClass.name: closed
outputsClass.description: Event emitted when the select has been closed.

outputsClass.name: opened
outputsClass.description: Event emitted when the select has been opened.

outputsClass.name: openedChange
outputsClass.description: Event emitted when the select panel has been toggled.

outputsClass.name: selectionChange
outputsClass.description: Event emitted when the selected value has been changed by the user.

outputsClass.name: valueChange
outputsClass.description: Event that emits whenever the raw value of the select changes. This is here primarily to facilitate the two-way binding for the value input.

propertiesClass.name: _ariaDescribedby
propertiesClass.description: The aria-describedby attribute on the select for improved a11y.

propertiesClass.name: _compareWith
propertiesClass.description: Comparison function to specify which option is displayed. Defaults to object equality.

propertiesClass.name: _destroy
propertiesClass.description: Emits whenever the component is destroyed.

propertiesClass.name: _disableOptionCentering
propertiesClass.description: Whether the component is disabling centering of the active option over the trigger.

propertiesClass.name: _keyManager
propertiesClass.description: Manages keyboard events for options in the panel.

propertiesClass.name: _multiple
propertiesClass.description: Whether the component is in multiple selection mode.

propertiesClass.name: _offsetY
propertiesClass.description: The y-offset of the overlay panel in relation to the trigger's top start corner. This must be adjusted to align the selected option text over the trigger text. when the panel opens. Will change based on the y-position of the selected option.

propertiesClass.name: _onChange
propertiesClass.description: View -> model callback called when value changes

propertiesClass.name: _onTouched
propertiesClass.description: View -> model callback called when select has been touched

propertiesClass.name: _optionIds
propertiesClass.description: The IDs of child options to be passed to the aria-owns attribute.

propertiesClass.name: _panelDoneAnimatingStream
propertiesClass.description: Emits when the panel element is finished transforming in.

propertiesClass.name: _panelOpen
propertiesClass.description: Whether or not the overlay panel is open.

propertiesClass.name: _placeholder
propertiesClass.description: The placeholder displayed in the trigger of the select.

propertiesClass.name: _positions
propertiesClass.description: This position config ensures that the top "start" corner of the overlay is aligned with with the top "start" of the origin by default (overlapping the trigger completely). If the panel cannot fit below the trigger, it will fall back to a position above the trigger.

propertiesClass.name: _required
propertiesClass.description: Whether filling out the select is required in the form.

propertiesClass.name: _scrollStrategy
propertiesClass.description: Strategy that will be used to handle scrolling while the select panel is open.

propertiesClass.name: _scrollTop
propertiesClass.description: The scroll position of the overlay panel, calculated to center the selected option.

propertiesClass.name: _selectionModel
propertiesClass.description: Deals with the selection logic.

propertiesClass.name: _transformOrigin
propertiesClass.description: The value of the select panel's transform-origin property.

propertiesClass.name: _triggerFontSize
propertiesClass.description: The cached font-size of the trigger element.

propertiesClass.name: _triggerRect
propertiesClass.description: The last measured value for the trigger's client bounding rect.

propertiesClass.name: _uid
propertiesClass.description: Unique id for this input.

propertiesClass.name: controlType
propertiesClass.description: A name for this control that can be used by mat-form-field.

propertiesClass.name: customTrigger
propertiesClass.description: User-supplied override of the trigger element.

propertiesClass.name: optionGroups
propertiesClass.description: All of the defined groups of options.

propertiesClass.name: options
propertiesClass.description: All of the defined select options.

propertiesClass.name: optionSelectionChanges
propertiesClass.description: Combined stream of all of the child options' change events.

propertiesClass.name: overlayDir
propertiesClass.description: Overlay pane containing the options.

jsdoctags.comment: To be turned into a private API.

propertiesClass.name: panel
propertiesClass.description: Panel containing the select options.

propertiesClass.name: trigger
propertiesClass.description: Trigger that opens the select.

methodsClass.name: _adjustPanelDown
methodsClass.description: Adjusts the overlay panel down to fit in the viewport.

methodsClass.name: _adjustPanelUp
methodsClass.description: Adjusts the overlay panel up to fit in the viewport.

methodsClass.name: _calculateOverlayOffsetX
methodsClass.description: Sets the x-offset of the overlay panel in relation to the trigger's top start corner. This must be adjusted to align the selected option text over the trigger text when the panel opens. Will change based on LTR or RTL text direction. Note that the offset can't be calculated until the panel has been attached, because we need to know the content width in order to constrain the panel within the viewport.

methodsClass.name: _calculateOverlayOffsetY
methodsClass.description: Calculates the y-offset of the select's overlay panel in relation to the top start corner of the trigger. It has to be adjusted in order for the selected option to be aligned over the trigger when the panel opens.

methodsClass.name: _calculateOverlayPosition
methodsClass.description: Calculates the scroll position and x- and y-offsets of the overlay panel.

methodsClass.name: _calculateOverlayScroll
methodsClass.description:
Calculates the scroll position of the select's overlay panel.

Attempts to center the selected option in the panel. If the option is too high or too low in the panel to be scrolled to the center, it clamps the scroll position to the min or max scroll positions respectively.

methodsClass.name: _checkOverlayWithinViewport
methodsClass.description: Checks that the attempted overlay position will fit within the viewport. If it will not fit, tries to adjust the scroll position and the associated y-offset so the panel can open fully on-screen. If it still won't fit, sets the offset back to 0 to allow the fallback position to take over.

methodsClass.name: _getAriaActiveDescendant
methodsClass.description: Determines the aria-activedescendant to be set on the host.

methodsClass.name: _getAriaLabel
methodsClass.description: Returns the aria-label of the select component.

methodsClass.name: _getAriaLabelledby
methodsClass.description: Returns the aria-labelledby of the select component.

methodsClass.name: _getItemCount
methodsClass.description: Calculates the amount of items in the select. This includes options and group labels.

methodsClass.name: _getItemHeight
methodsClass.description: Calculates the height of the select's options.

methodsClass.name: _getOptionIndex
methodsClass.description: Gets the index of the provided option in the option list.

methodsClass.name: _getOriginBasedOnOption
methodsClass.description: Sets the transform origin point based on the selected option.

methodsClass.name: _getPanelTheme
methodsClass.description: Returns the theme to be used on the panel.

methodsClass.name: _handleClosedKeydown
methodsClass.description: Handles keyboard events while the select is closed.

methodsClass.name: _handleKeydown
methodsClass.description: Handles all keydown events on the select.

methodsClass.name: _handleOpenKeydown
methodsClass.description: Handles keyboard events when the selected is open.

methodsClass.name: _highlightCorrectOption
methodsClass.description: Highlights the selected item. If no option is selected, it will highlight the first item instead.

methodsClass.name: _initKeyManager
methodsClass.description: Sets up a key manager to listen to keyboard events on the overlay panel.

methodsClass.name: _isRtl
methodsClass.description: Whether the element is in RTL mode.

methodsClass.name: _onAttached
methodsClass.description: Callback that is invoked when the overlay panel has been attached.

methodsClass.name: _onBlur
methodsClass.description: Calls the touched callback only if the panel is closed. Otherwise, the trigger will "blur" to the panel when it opens, causing a false positive.

methodsClass.name: _onSelect
methodsClass.description: Invoked when an option is clicked.

methodsClass.name: _propagateChanges
methodsClass.description: Emits change event to set the model value.

methodsClass.name: _resetOptions
methodsClass.description: Drops current option subscriptions and IDs and resets from scratch.

methodsClass.name: _scrollActiveOptionIntoView
methodsClass.description: Scrolls the active option into view.

methodsClass.name: _selectValue
methodsClass.description: Finds and selects and option based on its value.

methodsClass.name: _setOptionIds
methodsClass.description: Records option IDs to pass to the aria-owns property.

methodsClass.name: _setSelectionByValue
methodsClass.description: Sets the selected option based on a value. If no option can be found with the designated value, the select trigger is cleared.

methodsClass.name: _sortValues
methodsClass.description: Sorts the selected values in the selected based on their order in the panel.

methodsClass.name: close
methodsClass.description: Closes the overlay panel and focuses the host element.

methodsClass.name: focus
methodsClass.description: Focuses the select element.

methodsClass.name: onContainerClick
methodsClass.description: Implemented as part of MatFormFieldControl.

methodsClass.name: open
methodsClass.description: Opens the overlay panel.

methodsClass.name: registerOnChange
methodsClass.description: Saves a callback function to be invoked when the select's value changes from user input. Part of the ControlValueAccessor interface required to integrate with Angular's core forms API.

jsdoctags.comment: Callback to be triggered when the value changes.

methodsClass.name: registerOnTouched
methodsClass.description: Saves a callback function to be invoked when the select is blurred by the user. Part of the ControlValueAccessor interface required to integrate with Angular's core forms API.

jsdoctags.comment: Callback to be triggered when the component has been touched.

methodsClass.name: setDescribedByIds
methodsClass.description: Implemented as part of MatFormFieldControl.

methodsClass.name: setDisabledState
methodsClass.description: Disables the select. Part of the ControlValueAccessor interface required to integrate with Angular's core forms API.

methodsClass.name: toggle
methodsClass.description: Toggles the overlay panel open or closed.

methodsClass.name: writeValue
methodsClass.description: Sets the select's value. Part of the ControlValueAccessor interface required to integrate with Angular's core forms API.

jsdoctags.comment: New value to be written to the model.

getSignature.description: Whether or not the overlay panel is open.

components.name: ProductPageComponent
components.templateData:
A flexible, tax-friendly way to invest for the future…

Save your way

Start your investment with a £1,000 lump sum or £100 per month.

Track your progress

Manage your account online and watch your investment grow.

Top up anytime

Invest up to the full ISA limit of £20,000 in the 2020/2021 tax year.

  • One for the future
  • Save your way
  • Risk versus reward
  • Invested by experts

Risk versus reward

If you choose to invest in The With Profits ISA, you’ll need to be comfortable with an element of risk. As with any investment, you may get back less than what you paid in.

At Wesleyan, we classify investment risk and reward using a 1 to 5 scale, where 1 represents the lowest risk and 5 represents the highest. We rate the With Profits ISA Fund as a risk category 3, meaning a moderate level of risk and reward.

If you aren't comfortable identifying the level of risk that's right for you, please book an appointment to receive financial advice.

Risk versus reward

If you choose to invest in The With Profits ISA, you’ll need to be comfortable with an element of risk. As with any investment, you may get back less than what you paid in.

At Wesleyan, we classify investment risk and reward using a 1 to 5 scale, where 1 represents the lowest risk and 5 represents the highest. We rate the With Profits ISA Fund as a risk category 3, meaning a moderate level of risk and reward.

If you aren't comfortable identifying the level of risk that's right for you, please book an appointment to receive financial advice.

With Profits ISA

Share in Wesleyan’s financial success

Open your ISA now

Existing With Profits ISA customer?
We've removed the 3% initial charge when you top-up online.

Why invest in a With Profits ISA?

The With Profits ISA is a stocks and shares ISA. It gives you the flexibility and tax advantages of an ISA, combined with the benefits of investing in our With Profits Fund.

  • Why InvestSave up to £20,000 in the 20/21 tax year
  • Pay no income tax or capital gains tax on your investment returns
  • Start drawing regular tax-free income after five years
  • Open with as little as £1000 (or £100 per month)
  • Pay no initial charge on your opening investment (when you apply online)
  • Transfer in from existing ISAs
  • Manage your account online
  • Invest in funds managed by an award-winning team*

Annual management charges apply . If you take advice from Wesleyan Financial Services, an initial advice charge will also apply.

Keep in mind that investment values can go down as well as up, so you could get back less than you invest.

Things to know before you apply

  • Charges
  • Smoothing and Market Value Reduction
  • ISA Rules
  • Key Documents

Charges

When you open a With Profits ISA, you’re agreeing to an Annual Management Charge. These charges are collected from your ISA to cover our costs in managing your account and investments. Depending on how you apply for your ISA, you may also incur an initial charge - but apply online, and there'll be no initial charge to pay.

Smoothing and Market Value Reductions (MVR)

To try and deliver steady returns, the With Profits Fund applies a mechanism called smoothing. This means we may hold back some of your returns when market performance is strong, in order to reduce the impact of periods of poor market returns.

If you choose to withdraw money from your ISA at certain times (usually when share prices have fallen substantially), we may also apply an adjustment which reduces how much you get back from that withdrawal. This is called a Market Value Reduction.

A Market Value Reduction is not a charge applied for Wesleyan's benefit. It’s designed to protect those still invested in the fund from a high volume of withdrawals being made by other customers at unfairly high valuations.

ISA and tax rules

You’ll pay no personal income tax or capital gains tax on your investment returns from the With Profits ISA. This is based on current understanding of legislation and tax treatment, which can change in the future.

You can invest in a stocks and shares ISA, cash ISA, Innovative Finance ISA or a Lifetime ISA or combination of all four in the same tax year - subject to maximum investment limits set by HM Revenue & Customs (£20,000 overall, of which up to £4,000 can be invested into a Lifetime ISA in the 2020/2021 tax year).

If you invest in a Wesleyan With Profits ISA, you will not be able to invest in another stocks and shares ISA during the same tax year (unless you transfer all of your current tax year investment from a Wesleyan With Profits ISA to another provider).

If your spouse or civil partner died on or after 3 December 2014 you may be entitled to additional ISA allowance, up to the value of your spouse or civil partner's ISA savings at the time of death. If this affects you, please contact your Financial Consultant.

You are able to transfer existing ISA holdings from other providers, if you wish to consider this you will need to contact your Financial Consultant.

Please note you have the right to cancel your new investment within 30 days of the date you receive your cancellation notice (part of your plan documentation).

Key documents

Before you apply to open a With Profits ISA, please read the following documents:

  • How it works
  • Investment performance
  • Product features
  • FAQs
  • How to open your ISA
  • How it works
  • Investment performance
  • Product features
  • FAQs
  • How to open your ISA

How it works

When you save money into your ISA, you buy units in our With Profits Fund. The fund aims to provide capital growth over a medium to long-term period, investing in UK and international shares, government and corporate debt, property, cash and other financial investments (you can take a look at our With Profits ISA factsheet (PDF 200kb) to find out more about how the fund invests). Crucially, our With Profits Fund differs from other investment funds in two key respects - profit sharing and smoothing:

01

Share in our success

The value of the With Profits Fund depends not just on returns from our investments, but also on Wesleyan’s profits and losses from across the business. As a mutual, we have no shareholders to pay - so we can share our financial successes with you. We do this where possible by adding regular bonuses to your ISA throughout the period of your investment. Sometimes, you might be entitled to a final bonus too. We can’t promise to pay bonuses, but when we do add them, they are guaranteed (subject to any Market Value Reduction (MVR) in place) - and can make a significant difference to your final cash-in value.

02

Smoother, steadier returns

While all investments are subject to the volatility of the stock market, our fund seeks to reduce sharp rises and falls through a mechanism called smoothing. This means holding back some returns when market performance is strong, to support returns when the market experiences losses - mitigating the effect of any short-term market fluctuations. Before you apply for your ISA, please make sure you understand how smoothing, bonuses and Market Value Reductions (MVRs) work. They are discussed in the How our With Profits Fund works (PDF 200kb) booklet.

Ready to open your With Profits ISA?

You can open a With Profits ISA online or via your Wesleyan Financial Services Consultant.

Open online No initial charge when you open your ISA online
Book an appointment 3% initial charge applies for advised applications
  • Is the With Profits ISA a Stocks and Shares ISA?

    Yes it is. We call ours a With Profits ISA as it's invested in our With Profits Fund, but it works like most other Stocks and Shares ISAs. The money you save into your ISA is invested into the stock market by our fund managers, to trey and make your savings go further.

  • Am I eligible for a With Profits ISA?

    Our With Profits ISA is open to UK residents aged between 18 and 19. before you can open your ISA, we'll just need you to complete an appropriateness test to check your suitability. How much can I invest in a With Profits ISA?

  • How much can I invest in a With Profits ISA?

    Each tax year (6 April to 5 April), there's a certain amount of money you're allowed to put into an ISA. For tax year 20/21, that allowance is £20,000. Just be aware that tax rules for ISAs can and do change, so the allowance may vary from year to year.

  • How do bonuses work?

    Each tax year (6 April to 5 April), there's a certain amount of money you're allowed to put into an ISA. For tax year 20/21, that allowance is £20,000. Just be aware that tax rules for ISAs can and do change, so the allowance may vary from year to year.

With Profits ISA - Key Information Document PDF (200kb)
1 year £9801 1 year £9801 2 years £9801 3 years £49801 4 years £29801 5 years £19801
With Profits ISA Initial and Annual Management Charges
Initial charge for online applications None
Initial charge for advised applications or transfers 3% of your contribution or transfer in

One for the future

The With Profits ISA is best suited to those willing to invest for a minimum of five years, allowing more time to benefit from any potential capital growth. After five years, you can also start to draw regular monthly income from your account.

Save your way

Whether you have a lump sum ready to invest, or you want to build your savings month by month, the Wesleyan With Profits ISA can work for you. You can open an ISA with a minimum investment of £1,000, or by setting up monthly contributions from £100 per month.
You can also top up your ISA at any time to make the most of your yearly ISA allowance, with a £500 minimum lump-sum contribution. Read more on ISA rules and allowances here.

Risk versus reward

If you choose to invest in The With Profits ISA, you’ll need to be comfortable with an element of risk. As with any investment, you may get back less than what you paid in.
At Wesleyan, we classify investment risk and reward using a 1 to 5 scale, where 1 represents the lowest risk and 5 represents the highest. We rate the With Profits ISA Fund as a risk category 3, meaning a moderate level of risk and reward.
If you aren't comfortable identifying the level of risk that's right for you, please book an appointment to receive financial advice.

Invested by experts

You don’t need to be a skilled investor to open a With Profits ISA.
Our experienced investment team (Investment Team of the Year at the Insurance Asset Risk Awards 2020) manages the fund on your behalf - so you can concentrate simply on saving.

components.name: WesCheckbox

inputsClass.name: aria-describedby
inputsClass.description: The 'aria-describedby' attribute is read after the element's label and field type.

inputsClass.name: aria-label
inputsClass.description: Attached to the aria-label attribute of the host element. In most cases, aria-labelledby will take precedence so this may be omitted.

inputsClass.name: aria-labelledby
inputsClass.description: Users can specify the aria-labelledby attribute which will be forwarded to the input element

inputsClass.name: checked
inputsClass.description: Whether the checkbox is checked.

inputsClass.name: disabled
inputsClass.description: Whether the checkbox is disabled. This fully overrides the implementation provided by mixinDisabled, but the mixin is still required because mixinTabIndex requires it.

inputsClass.name: id
inputsClass.description: A unique id for the checkbox input. If none is supplied, it will be auto-generated.

inputsClass.name: indeterminate
inputsClass.description: Whether the checkbox is indeterminate. This is also known as "mixed" mode and can be used to represent a checkbox with three states, e.g. a checkbox that represents a nested list of checkable items. Note that whenever checkbox is manually clicked, indeterminate is immediately set to false.

inputsClass.name: inputTestId
inputsClass.description: The unique test ID for the input.

inputsClass.name: labelPosition
inputsClass.description: Whether the label should appear after or before the checkbox. Defaults to 'after'

inputsClass.name: labelTestId
inputsClass.description: The unique test ID for the label.

inputsClass.name: name
inputsClass.description: Name value will be applied to the input element if present

inputsClass.name: required
inputsClass.description: Whether the checkbox is required.

inputsClass.name: value
inputsClass.description: The value attribute of the native input element

outputsClass.name: change
outputsClass.description: Event emitted when the checkbox's checked value changes.

outputsClass.name: indeterminateChange
outputsClass.description: Event emitted when the checkbox's indeterminate value changes.

propertiesClass.name: _inputElement
propertiesClass.description: The native <input type="checkbox"> element

propertiesClass.name: _onTouched
propertiesClass.description: Called when the checkbox is blurred. Needed to properly implement ControlValueAccessor.

propertiesClass.name: ripple
propertiesClass.description: Reference to the ripple instance of the checkbox.

methodsClass.name: _onInputClick
methodsClass.description: Event handler for checkbox input element. Toggles checked state if element is not disabled. Do not toggle on (change) event since IE doesn't fire change event when indeterminate checkbox is clicked.

methodsClass.name: _onLabelTextChange
methodsClass.description: Method being called whenever the label text changes.

methodsClass.name: _syncIndeterminate
methodsClass.description:
Syncs the indeterminate value with the checkbox DOM node.

We sync indeterminate directly on the DOM node, because in Ivy the check for whether a property is supported on an element boils down to if (propName in element). Domino's HTMLInputElement doesn't have an indeterminate property so Ivy will warn during server-side rendering.

methodsClass.name: focus
methodsClass.description: Focuses the checkbox.

methodsClass.name: toggle
methodsClass.description: Toggles the checked state of the checkbox.

components.description: A material design checkbox component. Supports all of the functionality of an HTML5 checkbox, and exposes a similar API. A MatCheckbox can be either checked, unchecked, indeterminate, or disabled. Note that all additional accessibility attributes are taken care of by the component, so there is no need to provide them yourself. However, if you want to omit a label and still have the checkbox be accessible, you may supply an [aria-label] input. See: https://material.io/design/components/selection-controls.html
components.rawdescription:
A material design checkbox component. Supports all of the functionality of an HTML5 checkbox,
and exposes a similar API. A MatCheckbox can be either checked, unchecked, indeterminate, or
disabled. Note that all additional accessibility attributes are taken care of by the component,
so there is no need to provide them yourself. However, if you want to omit a label and still
have the checkbox be accessible, you may supply an [aria-label] input.
See: https://material.io/design/components/selection-controls.html

getSignature.name: inputId
getSignature.description: Returns the unique id for the visual hidden input.

components.name: WesFormField

inputsClass.name: appearance
inputsClass.description: The form-field appearance style.

inputsClass.name: floatLabel
inputsClass.description:
Whether the label should always float, never float or float as the user types.

Note: only the legacy appearance supports the never option. never was originally added as a way to make the floating label emulate the behavior of a standard input placeholder. However the form field now supports both floating labels and placeholders. Therefore in the non-legacy appearances the never option has been disabled in favor of just using the placeholder.

inputsClass.name: hideRequiredMarker
inputsClass.description: Whether the required marker should be hidden.

inputsClass.name: hintLabel
inputsClass.description: Text for the form field hint.

propertiesClass.name: _animationsEnabled
propertiesClass.description: Whether the Angular animations are enabled.

propertiesClass.name: _outlineGapCalculationNeededImmediately
propertiesClass.description: Whether the outline gap needs to be calculated immediately on the next change detection run.

propertiesClass.name: _outlineGapCalculationNeededOnStable
propertiesClass.description: Whether the outline gap needs to be calculated next time the zone has stabilized.

propertiesClass.name: _showAlwaysAnimate
propertiesClass.description: Override for the logic that disables the label animation in certain cases.

propertiesClass.name: _subscriptAnimationState
propertiesClass.description: State of the mat-hint and mat-error animations.

methodsClass.name: _getDisplayedMessages
methodsClass.description: Determines whether to display hints or errors.

methodsClass.name: _getStartEnd
methodsClass.description: Gets the start end of the rect considering the current directionality.

methodsClass.name: _isAttachedToDOM
methodsClass.description: Checks whether the form field is attached to the DOM.

methodsClass.name: _processHints
methodsClass.description: Animates the placeholder up and locks it in position.

methodsClass.name: _shouldForward
methodsClass.description: Determines whether a class from the NgControl should be forwarded to the host element.

methodsClass.name: _syncDescribedByIds
methodsClass.description: Gets the default float label state.

methodsClass.name: _validateControlChild
methodsClass.description: Throws an error if the form field's control is missing.

methodsClass.name: _validateHints
methodsClass.description: Ensure that there is a maximum of one of each <mat-hint> alignment specified, with the attribute being considered as align="start".

methodsClass.name: getConnectedOverlayOrigin
methodsClass.description: Gets an ElementRef for the element that a overlay attached to the form-field should be positioned relative to.

variables.name: example
variables.defaultValue:
() => ({ template: `

NHS Pension Scheme Guide

The NHS pension scheme is a well-earned benefit for the hard workers of the health service.

On this page

  • Where to start with saving for a house
  • How to save for your deposit
  • The best accounts for saving for a house
  • The extra costs you’ll need to think about
  • Other options for first-time buyers
  • Maintaining the saving habit

Where to start with saving for a house

Saving for a house deposit can be a daunting prospect at the best of times, and if you’re already spending a significant chunk of your income on rent, it’s even more of a challenge. Like all challenges, this one is best tackled with a plan - and that plan starts with understanding how much you’ll need to save.

While it’s possible to buy a property with a 5% deposit in some cases, most mortgage lenders require a down payment of at least 10% of the property price. Some sources suggest the average first-time buyer deposit is closer to 20%.

Usually, the more deposit you can put down, the better, as it means you’ll need to borrow less. It also reduces the Loan-to-value (LTV) rate, which typically means you’ll get a better deal on your mortgage.

Stay in the saving habit

It can be a long road to your first house, but when you do finally have the keys to your own place, it’s important you keep the saving habit going. If you can keep putting a little money into your savings each month - once you’ve splashed out on that new sofa, anyway - you’ll be in a much stronger position when it comes to your next move.

Other options to help you save

The associated costs of buying a home can make for pretty intimidating reading - even more so if you’re currently struggling to save due to renting. Often, there’s simply not much money left to set aside each month once rent, bills, council tax and other basic essentials have been paid for.

If that’s the situation you find yourself in, don’t worry. Buying a home might seem a long way off right now, but you do have options. If it’s rent that’s holding you back, a change of circumstance might be necessary - maybe you could move somewhere cheaper, flat-share, or move back home for a short period of intense saving?

Or if you can’t do anything to reduce your outgoings, is there any way to boost your income? A second job perhaps?

Even if you have to accept that raising a full house deposit on your own just might not be doable, there’s still plenty of routes you can go down to open the door to home ownership…

Need our advice?

From buying your first property to planning for retirement, Wesleyan Financial Services Consultants can provide expert financial advice at every stage of your life and career.

See how we can help

variables.name: example
variables.defaultValue:
() => ({ template: `

Unit Trust ISA

Tax-friendly investment, at a risk level right for you

Open your ISA now

Existing customer? Manage your investment account here

Why choose a Unit Trust ISA?

A simple, transparent stocks and shares ISA from Wesleyan Unit Trust Managers (WUTM), the Unit Trust ISA lets you invest in a range of risk-rated funds, each expertly managed on your behalf.

  • Save up to £20,000 in the 2020/2021 tax year
  • Pay no income tax or capital gains tax on your investment returns
  • Take your pick from six funds to suit your own appetite for risk
  • Leave your investment in the hands of our award-winning Fund Managers
  • Open an account online with no initial charge*
  • View your portfolio online at any time

Dealing costs and ongoing charges will apply. If you take advice from a Wesleyan Financial Services Consultant, an initial advice charge will also apply.

How it works

Our Unit Trust ISA allows you to invest your tax-free ISA allowance (£20,000 for 2020/2021) in a range of funds managed by WUTM’s award-winning team.

When you invest in our Unit Trust funds, you’re effectively pooling your money with other investors - giving you the collective buying power to invest in things that might be hard to access on your own.

All our funds are invested differently to suit a range of different risk appetites, but typically, you’ll be putting your money into stocks, shares, bonds and other securities.

How it works

If those underlying assets perform well, your fund units gain value and your pot grows. Best of all, you won’t pay tax on any potential gains you make.

For more information, read our guide to Investing in Unit Trusts.

Ready to open your Unit Trust ISA?

There are a couple of ways you can open your Unit Trust ISA. You can apply quickly and conveniently online or book an appointment with a Wesleyan Financial Services Consultant*.

Apply onlineBook an appointment

*3% initial charge applies for advised applications

Want to transfer in from an existing ISA? You’ll need to book an appointment with a Wesleyan Financial Services Consultant (initial advice charge applies).

Got a question about the Unit Trust ISA? Call us on 0330 123 3813. We're open Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm.

`, })

variables.name: example
variables.defaultValue:
() => ({ template: `

Meet our investments team

Award-winning fund management from a team that puts you first

When you’re investing your hard-earned cash, you want to entrust it with a team that puts you first. From our Fund Managers to our Investment Analysts, we’re here to help you reach your financial goals. Whether you’re looking to invest a one-off lump sum or make regular payments, we work hard to maximise your returns.

How we put you first

Our Fund Managers are in it for the long run. They've each worked with Wesleyan for ten years or more, committed to getting the best possible long-term fund performance and return for our customers. They've even won multiple awards for their achievements, including Investment Team of the Year in 2020 (Insurance Asset Risk Awards).

Our team has managed your money through a number of market events, like the bursting of the dot-com bubble and the global financial crisis to the latest worldwide pandemic, keeping your investments at the front of their minds. At Wesleyan, we use market volatility to our advantage, finding investment opportunities to benefit our funds.

Our long-term view

Wondering how we manage your investments? We look for the long-term value in shares that others may pass over. Paired with our 'buy and hold' approach, we have a portfolio turnover that's low by industry standards.

All of this means that we're constantly using our expertise and experience to give you the best possible chance of higher financial returns over the long term.

Martin Lawrence

Martin is our Director of Investments. variables.description: Injection token to be used to override the default options for mat-checkbox.

variables.name: MAT_CHECKBOX_REQUIRED_VALIDATOR
MAT_ERROR
variables.description: Injection token that can be used to reference instances of MatError. It serves as alternative token to the actual MatError class which could cause unnecessary retention of the class and its directive metadata.

variables.name: MAT_FORM_FIELD
variables.description: Injection token that can be used to inject an instances of MatFormField. It serves as alternative token to the actual MatFormField class which would cause unnecessary retention of the MatFormField class and its component metadata.

variables.name: MAT_FORM_FIELD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS
variables.description: Injection token that can be used to configure the default options for all form field within an app.

variables.name: MAT_INPUT_VALUE_ACCESSOR
variables.description: This token is used to inject the object whose value should be set into MatInput. If none is provided, the native HTMLInputElement is used. Directives like MatDatepickerInput can provide themselves for this token, in order to make MatInput delegate the getting and setting of the value to them.

variables.name: MAT_PREFIX
variables.description: Injection token that can be used to reference instances of MatPrefix. It serves as alternative token to the actual MatPrefix class which could cause unnecessary retention of the class and its directive metadata.

variables.name: MAT_RADIO_DEFAULT_OPTIONS
MAT_RADIO_GROUP
variables.description: Injection token that can be used to inject instances of MatRadioGroup. It serves as alternative token to the actual MatRadioGroup class which could cause unnecessary retention of the class and its component metadata.

variables.name: MAT_RADIO_GROUP_CONTROL_VALUE_ACCESSOR
variables.description: Provider Expression that allows wes-radio-group to register as a ControlValueAccessor. This allows it to support [(ngModel)] and ngControl.

variables.description: Injection token that can be used to provide the default options the select module.

variables.name: MAT_SELECT_SCROLL_STRATEGY
variables.description: Injection token that determines the scroll handling while a select is open.

functions.name: getMatSelectNonArrayValueError

typealiases.name: MatCheckboxClickAction
typealiases.description: Checkbox click action when user click on input element. noop: Do not toggle checked or indeterminate. check: Only toggle checked status, ignore indeterminate. check-indeterminate: Toggle checked status, set indeterminate to false. Default behavior. undefined: Same as check-indeterminate.

libs/shared/ui-form-field/src/lib/hint.t.name: _MAT_HINT
libs/shared/ui-form-field/src/lib/hint.t.description:
Injection token that can be used to reference instances of MatHint. It serves as alternative token to the actual MatHint class which could cause unnecessary retention of the class and its directive metadata.

Note: This is not part of the public API as the MDC-based form-field will not need a lightweight token for MatHint and we want to reduce breaking changes.

libs/shared/ui-form-checkbox/src/lib/che.name: MAT_CHECKBOX_CONTROL_VALUE_ACCESSOR
libs/shared/ui-form-checkbox/src/lib/che.description: Provider Expression that allows mat-checkbox to register as a ControlValueAccessor. This allows it to support [(ngModel)].

libs/shared/ui-form-field/src/lib/form-f.name: _MatFormFieldMixinBase
libs/shared/ui-form-field/src/lib/form-f.description: Base class to which we're applying the form field mixins.

libs/shared/ui-form-field/src/lib/form-f.name: MAT_FORM_FIELD
libs/shared/ui-form-field/src/lib/form-f.description: Injection token that can be used to inject an instances of MatFormField. It serves as alternative token to the actual MatFormField class which would cause unnecessary retention of the MatFormField class and its component metadata.

libs/shared/ui-form-field/src/lib/form-f.name: MAT_FORM_FIELD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS
libs/shared/ui-form-field/src/lib/form-f.description: Injection token that can be used to configure the default options for all form field within an app.

MAT_RADIO_GROUP
libs/shared/ui-form-radio/src/lib/radio..description: Injection token that can be used to inject instances of MatRadioGroup. It serves as alternative token to the actual MatRadioGroup class which could cause unnecessary retention of the class and its component metadata.

libs/shared/ui-form-radio/src/lib/radio..name: MAT_RADIO_GROUP_CONTROL_VALUE_ACCESSOR

libs/shared/ui-form-select/src/lib/selec.name: SELECT_ITEM_HEIGHT_EM
libs/shared/ui-form-select/src/lib/selec.description: The height of the select items in em units.

libs/shared/ui-form-select/src/lib/selec.name: SELECT_MULTIPLE_PANEL_PADDING_X
libs/shared/ui-form-select/src/lib/selec.description:
Distance between the panel edge and the option text in multi-selection mode.

Calculated as: (SELECT_PANEL_PADDING_X * 1.5) + 16 = 40 The padding is multiplied by 1.5 because the checkbox's margin is half the padding. The checkbox width is 16px.

libs/shared/ui-form-select/src/lib/selec.description: The select panel will only "fit" inside the viewport if it is positioned at this value or more away from the viewport boundary.

libs/shared/storybook/src/lib/components.name: example
libs/shared/storybook/src/lib/components.defaultValue:
() => ({ template: `

NHS Pension Scheme Guide

The NHS pension scheme is a well-earned benefit for the hard workers of the health service.

On this page

  • Where to start with saving for a house
  • How to save for your deposit
  • The best accounts for saving for a house
  • The extra costs you’ll need to think about
  • Other options for first-time buyers
  • Maintaining the saving habit

Where to start with saving for a house

Saving for a house deposit can be a daunting prospect at the best of times, and if you’re already spending a significant chunk of your income on rent, it’s even more of a challenge. Like all challenges, this one is best tackled with a plan - and that plan starts with understanding how much you’ll need to save.

While it’s possible to buy a property with a 5% deposit in some cases, most mortgage lenders require a down payment of at least 10% of the property price. Some sources suggest the average first-time buyer deposit is closer to 20%.

Usually, the more deposit you can put down, the better, as it means you’ll need to borrow less. It also reduces the Loan-to-value (LTV) rate, which typically means you’ll get a better deal on your mortgage.

Stay in the saving habit

It can be a long road to your first house, but when you do finally have the keys to your own place, it’s important you keep the saving habit going. If you can keep putting a little money into your savings each month - once you’ve splashed out on that new sofa, anyway - you’ll be in a much stronger position when it comes to your next move.

Other options to help you save

The associated costs of buying a home can make for pretty intimidating reading - even more so if you’re currently struggling to save due to renting. Often, there’s simply not much money left to set aside each month once rent, bills, council tax and other basic essentials have been paid for.

If that’s the situation you find yourself in, don’t worry. Buying a home might seem a long way off right now, but you do have options. If it’s rent that’s holding you back, a change of circumstance might be necessary - maybe you could move somewhere cheaper, flat-share, or move back home for a short period of intense saving?

Or if you can’t do anything to reduce your outgoings, is there any way to boost your income? A second job perhaps?

Even if you have to accept that raising a full house deposit on your own just might not be doable, there’s still plenty of routes you can go down to open the door to home ownership…

Need our advice?

From buying your first property to planning for retirement, Wesleyan Financial Services Consultants can provide expert financial advice at every stage of your life and career.

See how we can help

You might be interested in…

Discover the world of investments - including advice on the various ways you can invest, understanding risk and how to become a smart investor.

libs/shared/storybook/src/lib/components.defaultValue:
() => ({ template: `

Unit Trust ISA

Tax-friendly investment, at a risk level right for you

Open your ISA now

Existing customer? Manage your investment account here

Why choose a Unit Trust ISA?

A simple, transparent stocks and shares ISA from Wesleyan Unit Trust Managers (WUTM), the Unit Trust ISA lets you invest in a range of risk-rated funds, each expertly managed on your behalf.

  • Save up to £20,000 in the 2020/2021 tax year
  • Pay no income tax or capital gains tax on your investment returns
  • Take your pick from six funds to suit your own appetite for risk
  • Leave your investment in the hands of our award-winning Fund Managers
  • Open an account online with no initial charge*
  • View your portfolio online at any time

Dealing costs and ongoing charges will apply. If you take advice from a Wesleyan Financial Services Consultant, an initial advice charge will also apply.

How it works

Our Unit Trust ISA allows you to invest your tax-free ISA allowance (£20,000 for 2020/2021) in a range of funds managed by WUTM’s award-winning team.

When you invest in our Unit Trust funds, you’re effectively pooling your money with other investors - giving you the collective buying power to invest in things that might be hard to access on your own.

All our funds are invested differently to suit a range of different risk appetites, but typically, you’ll be putting your money into stocks, shares, bonds and other securities.

How it works

If those underlying assets perform well, your fund units gain value and your pot grows. Best of all, you won’t pay tax on any potential gains you make.

For more information, read our guide to Investing in Unit Trusts.

Ready to open your Unit Trust ISA?

There are a couple of ways you can open your Unit Trust ISA. You can apply quickly and conveniently online or book an appointment with a Wesleyan Financial Services Consultant*.

Apply onlineBook an appointment

*3% initial charge applies for advised applications

Want to transfer in from an existing ISA? You’ll need to book an appointment with a Wesleyan Financial Services Consultant (initial advice charge applies).

Got a question about the Unit Trust ISA? Call us on 0330 123 3813. We're open Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm.

`, })

Meet our investments team

When you’re investing your hard-earned cash, you want to entrust it with a team that puts you first. Whether you’re looking to invest a one-off lump sum or make regular payments, we work hard to maximise your returns.

How we put you first

Our Fund Managers are in it for the long run. They've each worked with Wesleyan for ten years or more, committed to getting the best possible long-term fund performance and return for our customers. They've even won multiple awards for their achievements, including Investment Team of the Year in 2020 (Insurance Asset Risk Awards).

Our team has managed your money through a number of market events, like the bursting of the dot-com bubble and the global financial crisis to the latest worldwide pandemic, keeping your investments at the front of their minds. At Wesleyan, we use market volatility to our advantage, finding investment opportunities to benefit our funds.

Our long-term view

Wondering how we manage your investments? We look for the long-term value in shares that others may pass over. Paired with our 'buy and hold' approach, we have a portfolio turnover that's low by industry standards.

All of this means that we're constantly using our expertise and experience to give you the best possible chance of higher financial returns over the long term.

Martin Lawrence

Martin is our Director of Investments. He joined Wesleyan in 1995 as an Investment Analyst after graduating from the University of Exeter with a degree in Mathematics, subsequently qualifying as an Associate of the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) Society of the UK. He's been a Fund Manager since 2001. As well as managing the With Profits Fund, he's responsible for all our Fund and Property Managers, Analysts and Investment Communications Team. Martin is also a Director of Wesleyan Unit Trust Managers Ltd.
